page.title: 10LEIRE CHURCH
page.content:
{SAINT PETER'S CHURCH - LEIRE} This church is mentioned in the Domesday Book - "a Priest, 1085". The tower is late 13th century, the remainder being rebuilt in 1867 at a cost of Â£2,000, when the north aisle was added. The Children's Window dates from 1889, and was installed for Â£15, raised over 5 years by pennies collected from the children. The first recorded Rector was William de Leyre, 1210-1270. The current Rector of this and the two other churches of Ashby Parva and Dunton Bassett is Kenneth Henry Bilney. The oldest grave dates from 1732, commemorating John Mortimore. The furthest visitor to the church came from the U.S.A.
